body_html:
Some progress here:

According to my experiment, this issue is because when invoked by python -m, python is trying to pickle the module torch (I don't know why, and this should be fixed?). torch is a module and should not be pickled, usually, when a user try to pickle a module, python would raise an exception TypeError: can't pickle module objects, but unfortunately, the __reduce_ex__ of module torch is mistakenly replaced by the __reduce_ex__ of _C._VariableFunctions, which makes the error message very hard to understand.

#13884 fixes the issue that __reduce_ex__ of module torch is replaced

Some progress here:
According to my experiment, this issue is because when invoked by python -m, python is trying to pickle the module torch (I don't know why, and this should be fixed?). torch is a module and should not be pickled, usually, when a user try to pickle a module, python would raise an exception TypeError: can't pickle module objects, but unfortunately, the __reduce_ex__ of module torch is mistakenly replaced by the __reduce_ex__ of _C._VariableFunctions, which makes the error message very hard to understand.
#13884 fixes the issue that __reduce_ex__ of module torch is replaced
body:
Some progress here:

According to my experiment, this issue is because when invoked by `python -m`, python is trying to pickle the module `torch` (I don't know why, and this should be fixed?). `torch` is a module and should not be pickled, usually, when a user try to pickle a module, python would raise an exception `TypeError: can't pickle module objects`, but unfortunately, the `__reduce_ex__` of module `torch` is mistakenly replaced by the `__reduce_ex__` of `_C._VariableFunctions`, which makes the error message very hard to understand.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/13884 fixes the issue that `__reduce_ex__` of module `torch` is replaced
